cards.name: Underworld Dreams
cards.text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to him or her.
cards.flavor:
"In the drowsy dark cave of the mind, dreams build their nest with fragments dropped from day's caravan."
—Rabindranath Tagore

rulings.text: If multiple cards are drawn at once, this card triggers once for each card drawn.
In a multi-player game, it affects all opponents.

cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Meditate
cards.text: Draw four cards. You skip your next turn.
cards.flavor:
"Part of me believes that Barrin taught me meditation simply to shut me up."
—Ertai, wizard adept

rulings.text: You skip one turn as part of the effect.

cards.originalText: Skip your next turn: Draw four cards.

cards.name: Barren Moor
cards.text:
Barren Moor enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B}.
Cycling {B} ({B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Barren Moor enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
Cycling {B} ({B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Metallic Rebuke
cards.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
cards.flavor:
"Too little, too late. The machine is in motion."
—Tezzeret

rulings.text: Improvise doesn't change a spell's mana cost or converted mana cost.

When calculating a spell's total cost, include any alternative costs, additional costs, or anything else that increases or reduces the cost to cast the spell. Improvise applies after the total cost is calculated.
Because improvise isn't an alternative cost, it can be used in conjunction with alternative costs.
Improvise can't pay for {W}, {U}, {B}, {R}, {G}, or {C} mana symbols in a spell's total cost.

Improvise can't be used to pay for anything other than the cost of casting the spell. For example, it can't be used during the resolution of an ability that says "Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}."

If an artifact you control has a mana ability with {T} in the cost, activating that ability while casting a spell with improvise will result in the artifact being tapped when you pay the spell's costs. You won't be able to tap it again for improvise. Similarly, if you sacrifice an artifact to activate a mana ability while casting a spell with improvise, that artifact won't be on the battlefield when you pay the spell's costs, so you won't be able to tap it for improvise.
Tapping an artifact won't cause its abilities to stop applying unless those abilities say so.
Equipment attached to a creature doesn't become tapped when that creature becomes tapped, and tapping that Equipment doesn't cause the creature to become tapped.

cards.originalText:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

cards.name: Woolly Mammoths
cards.text: Woolly Mammoths has trample as long as you control a snow land.
cards.flavor:
"Mammoths may be good to ride on, but they're certainly bad to fall off of!"
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
cards.originalText: Gains trample as long as you control any snow-covered lands.

cards.name: Sibsig Icebreakers
cards.text: When Sibsig Icebreakers enters the battlefield, each player discards a card.
cards.flavor:
"I almost envy them. They can't get frostbite."
—Kirada, Silumgar enforcer
cards.originalText: When Sibsig Icebreakers enters the battlefield, each player discards a card.

cards.name: Silverback Ape
cards.flavor: His true majesty is not in his silver, but in his size.

cards.name: Brain in a Jar
cards.text:
{1}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Brain in a Jar, then you may cast an instant or sorcery card with converted mana cost equal to the number of charge counters on Brain in a Jar from your hand without paying its mana cost.
{3}, {T}, Remove X charge counters from Brain in a Jar: Scry X.

rulings.text: When resolving the first ability of Brain in a Jar, the newly-placed charge counter will be counted when determining what spells you may cast. No player may take any action between you placing the counter and choosing which spell to cast.

If Brain in a Jar leaves the battlefield before its first ability resolves, use the number of counters on it at the moment it left to determine what spell you may cast. That number won't change because you can't put a new counter on Brain in a Jar.

If you cast a card "without paying its mana cost," you can't choose to cast it for any alternative costs, such as awaken costs. You can, however, pay additional costs, such as kicker costs. If the card has any mandatory additional costs, such as that of Lightning Axe, you must pay those to cast the card.
If the card has {X} in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as the value of X.

cards.originalText:
{1}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Brain in a Jar, then you may cast an instant or sorcery card with converted mana cost equal to the number of charge counters on Brain in a Jar from your hand without paying its mana cost.
{3}, {T}, Remove X charge counters from Brain in a Jar: Scry X.

cards.name: Battlefield Percher
cards.text:
Flying
Battlefield Percher can block only creatures with flying.
{1}{B}: Battlefield Percher gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Flying 
Battlefield Percher can block only creatures with flying. 
{1}{B}: Battlefield Percher gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Blood Tribute
cards.text:
Kicker—Tap an untapped Vampire you control. (You may tap a Vampire you control in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Target opponent loses half their life, rounded up. If this spell was kicked, you gain life equal to the life lost this way.

rulings.text: You can tap a creature that hasn't been under your control since your most recent turn began to pay the kicker cost.

cards.originalText:
Kicker—Tap an untapped Vampire you control. (You may tap a Vampire you control in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Target opponent loses half his or her life, rounded up. If Blood Tribute was kicked, you gain life equal to the life lost this way.

cards.name: Disintegrate
cards.text: Disintegrate deals X damage to any target. If it's a creature, it can't be regenerated this turn, and if it would die this turn, exile it instead.

rulings.text: The "can't regenerate" is an effect of Disintegrate and not an effect of the damage. It works even if the damage is prevented or redirected. If redirected, the damage does not take this effect with it.
Disintegrated creatures do not go to the graveyard at all before being exiled. They do not trigger abilities which trigger due to a creature going to the graveyard.

cards.originalText: Disintegrate deals X damage to target creature or player. That creature can't be regenerated this turn. If the creature would be put into a graveyard this turn, remove it from the game instead.

cards.name: Sorcerer's Strongbox
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, sacrifice Sorcerer's Strongbox and draw three cards.
cards.flavor: Simun the Quiet filled the chest with his most precious thoughts. But in a fit of paranoia, he locked up the memory of where he hid the key.

rulings.text: If you lose the flip, nothing happens.
If you no longer control Sorcerer's Strongbox by the time you win the flip, you won't be able to sacrifice it. You'll still draw three cards, though.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, sacrifice Sorcerer's Strongbox and draw three cards.

cards.name: Atzocan Archer
cards.text:
Reach
When Atzocan Archer enters the battlefield, you may have it fight another target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
cards.flavor: His arrows are fletched with feathers from the greatest of the winged dinosaurs.

rulings.text: You must choose another target creature (if able) as Atzocan Archer's triggered ability is put on the stack. You choose as that ability resolves whether those creatures fight.
If Atzocan Archer isn't on the battlefield as its triggered ability resolves, or if the target of that ability is illegal, no creature will deal or be dealt damage.
Atzocan Archer's ability can target another creature you control (such as a Dinosaur with an enrage ability).

cards.originalText:
Reach
When Atzocan Archer enters the battlefield, you may have it fight another target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.name: Rebuild
cards.text:
Return all artifacts to their owners' hands.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Remember that cards only affect things which are on the battlefield unless they specifically say otherwise. So this only applies to artifacts on the battlefield.

Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Return all artifacts to owners' hands.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

cards.name: Cleanse
cards.text: Destroy all black creatures.
cards.flavor: The clouds broke and the sun's rays burst forth; each foul beast in its turn faltered, and was gone.
cards.originalText: Destroy all black creatures.

cards.name: Llawan, Cephalid Empress
cards.text:
When Llawan, Cephalid Empress enters the battlefield, return all blue creatures your opponents control to their owners' hands.
Your opponents can't cast blue creature spells.
cards.originalText:
When Llawan, Cephalid Empress comes into play, return all blue creatures your opponents control to their owners' hands.
Your opponents can't play blue creature spells.

cards.name: Acid Web Spider
cards.text:
Reach
When Acid Web Spider enters the battlefield, you may destroy target Equipment.
cards.flavor: Its web is an excellent source of found copper for the daring or the stupid.
cards.originalText:
Reach
When Acid Web Spider enters the battlefield, you may destroy target Equipment.

cards.name: Congregate
cards.text: Target player gains 2 life for each creature on the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"In the gathering there is strength for all who founder, renewal for all who languish, love for all who sing."
—Song of All, canto 642

rulings.text: Creatures are counted during resolution.

cards.originalText: Target player gains 2 life for each creature in play.

cards.name: Swiftfoot Boots
cards.text:
Equipped creature has hexproof and haste.
Equip {1}
cards.flavor:
"There is great wisdom in rushing headlong into combat . . . if you're prepared."
—Kenjek, captain of the Thousand Swords

rulings.text: If a creature enters the battlefield under your control and gains haste, but then loses it before attacking, it won't be able to attack that turn. This means that you can't use one Swiftfoot Boots to allow two new creatures to attack in the same turn.

cards.originalText:
Equipped creature has hexproof and haste.
Equip {1}

cards.name: City in a Bottle
cards.text:
Whenever another nontoken permanent with a name originally printed in the Arabian Nights expansion is on the battlefield, its controller sacrifices it.
Players can't cast spells or play lands with a name originally printed in the Arabian Nights expansion.

rulings.text: Token creatures and counters created by Arabian Nights cards are not removed.

Any time a player receives priority to cast spells or activate abilities, check to see whether any permanents on the battlefield were originally printed in the Arabian Nights expansion (even if the physical card representing that permanent is a reprint with a different expansion symbol). If there are any such permanents, the ability will trigger and those permanents will be sacrificed.

cards.originalText: All cards from Arabian Nights must be discarded from play, except for City in a Bottle. While City in a Bottle is in play, no further cards from Arabian Nights can be played.

cards.name: Kraken's Eye
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Bright as a mirror, dark as the sea.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a blue spell.
If a player casts a blue spell, Kraken's Eye's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Kraken's Eye's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a blue spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Cursed Scroll
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Choose a card name, then reveal a card at random from your hand. If that card has the chosen name, Cursed Scroll deals 2 damage to any target.

rulings.text: If you have no cards in hand, you still have to name a card. Then you fail to reveal one (since there aren't any). Since the named card wasn't revealed, no damage is dealt.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Name a card. Reveal a card at random from your hand. If it's the named card, Cursed Scroll deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Wall of Essence
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Essence is dealt combat damage, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor:
The ceiling and the floor fell in love, but only the wall knew.
—Dal saying

rulings.text: Wall of Essence's triggered ability will trigger even if it's dealt lethal damage. For example, if it's dealt 7 combat damage, its ability will trigger and you'll gain 7 life.

cards.originalText:
(Walls cannot attack.)
For each 1 combat damage dealt to Wall of Essence, gain 1 life.

cards.name: Gilt-Leaf Seer
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: {G}, {T}: Look at the top two cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
cards.flavor: Desmera blinded her seers so that her beauty would be the last image burned in their memories. The act only deepened their insight.
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}: Look at the top two cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

cards.name: Kalastria Highborn
cards.text: Whenever Kalastria Highborn or another Vampire you control dies, you may pay {B}. If you do, target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: Each of Malakir's great families boasts a contingent of nulls appropriate to its rank in society.

rulings.text: If multiple Vampires you control (possibly including Kalastria Highborn itself) are put into their owners' graveyards at the same time, Kalastria Highborn's ability triggers that many times.
You target a player when the ability triggers. You choose whether to pay {B} as the ability resolves. You may pay {B} only once per resolution.

If the targeted player is an illegal target by the time the ability resolves (for example, if that player has left a multiplayer game), the entire ability doesn't resolve. You can't pay {B} and you don't gain life.

cards.originalText: Whenever Kalastria Highborn or another Vampire you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {B}. If you do, target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Sorceress Queen
cards.text: {T}: Target creature other than Sorceress Queen has base power and toughness 0/2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {T}: Make another creature 0/2 until end of turn. Treat this exactly as if the numbers in the lower right of the target card were 0/2. All special characteristics and enchantments on the creature are unaffected.

cards.name: Gilded Light
cards.text:
You gain shroud until end of turn. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: "Whoever survives the first blow lives to land the second."

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
You can't be the target of spells or abilities this turn.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card from your hand: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Satyr Grovedancer
cards.text: When Satyr Grovedancer enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor: "Some of my kin dance for themselves, without greater purpose. Nylea gives me purpose, and with it strength."

foreignNames.name: サテュロスの木立ち踊り

cards.originalText: When Satyr Grovedancer enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Go for the Throat
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact creature.
cards.flavor: Having flesh is increasingly a liability on Mirrodin.

rulings.text: If the targeted creature is also an artifact when Go for the Throat tries to resolve, it won't resolve.

cards.originalText: Destroy target nonartifact creature.

cards.name: Feedback
cards.text:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, Feedback deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: Feedback deals 1 damage to controller of target enchantment during that player's upkeep.

cards.name: Skyshroud Ridgeback
cards.text: Fading 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
cards.originalText: Fading 2 (This creature comes into play with two fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)

cards.name: Zombie Master
cards.text:
Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Other Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."
cards.flavor: He controlled the zombies even before his own death; now nothing can make them betray him.
cards.originalText: All Zombies gain "{B} Regenerate" and swampwalk. (If defending player controls any swamps, these creatures are unblockable.)

cards.name: Daze
cards.text:
You may return an Island you control to its owner's hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

rulings.text: If another effect causes Daze to cost more, you must pay that additional cost even if you pay its alternative cost.

cards.originalText:
You may return an Island you control to its owner's hand rather than pay Daze's mana cost.
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

cards.name: Deep Water
cards.text: {U}: Until end of turn, if you tap a land you control for mana, it produces {U} instead of any other type.

rulings.text: Deep Waters affects lands you control when it resolves and any lands you gain control of this turn.
The amount of mana produced is unchanged, but it will all be {U}.

cards.originalText: {U}: All mana-producing lands you control provide {U} instead of their normal mana until end of turn.

cards.name: Highland Lake
cards.text:
Highland Lake enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {R}.
cards.flavor: With the fate of Innistrad uncertain, some seek solace in remote areas.
cards.originalText:
Highland Lake enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Seething Song
cards.text: Add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R}.
cards.flavor: If your flesh can withstand the flame, the spirit of the dragon will burn within your soul.
cards.originalText: Add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Goblin Sharpshooter
cards.text:
Goblin Sharpshooter doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever a creature dies, untap Goblin Sharpshooter.
{T}: Goblin Sharpshooter deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.originalText: Goblin Sharpshooter doesn't untap during your untap step.Whenever a creature dies, untap Goblin Sharpshooter.{T}: Goblin Sharpshooter deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Arvad the Cursed
cards.text:
Deathtouch, lifelink
Other legendary creatures you control get +2/+2.
cards.flavor: "I won't abandon the Weatherlight. My destiny is to serve at Jhoira's side. This 'illness' means I must trust my faith more and myself less."

rulings.text: Because damage remains marked on a creature until it's removed as the turn ends, nonlethal damage dealt to a legendary creature you control may become lethal if Arvad leaves the battlefield during that turn.

foreignNames.name: 呪われし者、アルヴァード

cards.originalText:
Deathtouch, lifelink
Other legendary creatures you control get +2/+2.

cards.name: Mystic Might
cards.text:
Enchant land you control
Cumulative upkeep {1}{U} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Enchanted land has "{T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn."

cards.name: Goblin Battle Jester
cards.text: Whenever you cast a red spell, target creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: Somehow goblins found a tactical advantage by sending a clown to war.
cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a red spell, target creature can't block this turn.

cards.name: Cinder Elemental
cards.text: {X}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Cinder Elemental: Cinder Elemental deals X damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Their rage can grow to such proportions that they explode in a cloud of fire.
cards.originalText: {X}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Cinder Elemental: Cinder Elemental deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Forest
cards.originalText: G

cards.name: Blinding Angel
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Blinding Angel deals combat damage to a player, that player skips their next combat phase.
cards.flavor: "Their eyes will shrivel and blacken before faith's true light."

rulings.text: If you are damaged by more than one, the effects are cumulative and you skip multiple combat phases.

cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
Whenever Blinding Angel deals combat damage to a player, that player skips his or her next combat phase.

cards.name: Skittering Heartstopper
cards.text: {B}: Skittering Heartstopper gains deathtouch until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It flows like water over the forest floor, as deadly as the swiftest current.
cards.originalText: {B}: Skittering Heartstopper gains deathtouch until end of turn.

cards.name: Rapacious One
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Rapacious One deals combat damage to a player, create that many 0/1 colorless Eldrazi Spawn creature tokens. They have "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C}."
cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever Rapacious One deals combat damage to a player, put that many 0/1 colorless Eldrazi Spawn creature tokens onto the battlefield. They have "Sacrifice this creature: Add {1} to your mana pool."

cards.name: Canopy Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: It keeps the upper reaches of the forest free of every menace . . . except for the spider itself.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.originalText: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Merfolk Wayfinder
cards.text:
Flying
When Merfolk Wayfinder enters the battlefield, reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all Island cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: If there are three or fewer cards in your library, you'll reveal all of them.

foreignNames.name: マーフォークの道探し

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Merfolk Wayfinder enters the battlefield, reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all Island cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Amrou Kithkin
cards.text: Amrou Kithkin can't be blocked by creatures with power 3 or greater.
cards.flavor: Quick and agile, Amrou Kithkin can usually escape from even the most fearsome opponents.

rulings.text: A creature with power 3 or greater can't be declared as a blocker for Amrou Kithkin. If the power of a creature that's already blocking Amrou Kithkin is increased to 3 or greater, it will continue to block Amrou Kithkin.

cards.originalText: No creature with power greater than 2 may be assigned to block Kithkin.

cards.name: Chainer, Dementia Master
cards.text:
Nightmare creatures get +1/+1.
{B}{B}{B}, Pay 3 life: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is black and is a Nightmare in addition to its other creature types.
When Chainer, Dementia Master leaves the battlefield, exile all Nightmares.
cards.originalText:
All Nightmares get +1/+1.
{B}{B}{B}, Pay 3 life: Put target creature card from a graveyard into play under your control. That creature is black and is a Nightmare in addition to its creature types.
When Chainer, Dementia Master leaves play, remove all Nightmares from the game.

cards.name: Terastodon
cards.text: When Terastodon enters the battlefield, you may destroy up to three target noncreature permanents. For each permanent put into a graveyard this way, its controller creates a 3/3 green Elephant creature token.

rulings.text: The targeted permanents may be controlled by different players.

If a targeted permanent has indestructible or regenerates, its controller won't get an Elephant token for it. Similarly, if the targeted permanent is destroyed but a replacement effect moves it to a different zone instead of its owner's graveyard, its controller won't get an Elephant token for it.

cards.originalText: When Terastodon enters the battlefield, you may destroy up to three target noncreature permanents. For each permanent put into a graveyard this way, its controller creates a 3/3 green Elephant creature token.

cards.name: Thraben Militia
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor: "The time for grief is over. The time for retribution has begun."
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Tovolar's Magehunter
cards.text:
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, Tovolar's Magehunter deals 2 damage to that player.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Tovolar's Magehunter.

foreignNames.name: トヴォラーの魔道士狩り

cards.source: Dark Ascension Launch Party participation bonus

cards.name: Malakir Soothsayer
cards.text: Cohort — {T}, Tap an untapped Ally you control: You draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor: "Your blood whispers secrets your mind could never comprehend."

rulings.text: To activate a cohort ability, the Ally with that ability must have been under your control continuously since the beginning of your most recent turn. Informally, it can't have "summoning sickness." However, the other Ally you tap can be one that just came under your control. (Note that tapping the second Ally doesn't use {T} [the tap symbol].)

cards.originalText: Cohort — {T}, Tap an untapped Ally you control: You draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Quicksilver Amulet
cards.text: {4}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Wonderful! You got a lion on your first try. Now put it back."

rulings.text: Any 'X' in the creature's cost is treated as zero.
Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.
You don't pay any costs of that creature card, including additional costs.

cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Choose a creature card in your hand and put that creature into play.

cards.name: Abzan Banner
cards.text:
{T}: Add {W}, {B}, or {G}.
{W}{B}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Abzan Banner: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Stone to endure, roots to remember.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {W}, {B}, or {G} to your mana pool.
{W}{B}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Abzan Banner: Draw a card.

cards.text:
Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

Protection from white

When Marker Beetles dies, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: In case of emergency, crush bug.

cards.name: Multani's Decree
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments. You gain 2 life for each enchantment destroyed this way.

—Multani, maro-sorcerer
cards.originalText: Destroy all enchantments. You gain 2 life for each enchantment destroyed this way.

cards.name: Thalia, Guardian of Thraben
cards.text:
First strike
Noncreature spells cost {1} more to cast.
cards.flavor: "Thraben is our home and I will not see it fall to this unhallowed horde."

rulings.text: Thalia's ability affects each spell that's not a creature spell, including your own.

To determine the total cost of a spell, start with the mana cost or alternative cost you're paying, add any cost increases, then apply any cost reductions. The converted mana cost of the spell remains unchanged, no matter what the total cost to cast it was.

Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Wayward Disciple
cards.text: Whenever Wayward Disciple or another creature you control dies, target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: ". . . and I will prove my devotion."

rulings.text: If Wayward Disciple dies at the same time as another creature you control, Wayward Disciple's ability triggers once for the other creature as well as once for itself.

cards.originalText: Whenever Wayward Disciple or another creature you control dies, target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Plated Slagwurm
cards.text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
cards.flavor: Beneath the Tangle, the wurm tunnels stretch . . . wide as a stone's throw, long as forever, deep as you dare.

cards.name: Steam Catapult
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.flavor: "You idiots! Turn it around! Turn it around!"

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.originalText: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

cards.name: Summer Bloom
cards.text: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.
cards.flavor: Summer sends its kiss with warmth and blooming life.

rulings.text: This spell increases the number of lands you can play in a turn. The land cards are played as you would normally play lands.

cards.originalText: Take up to three lands from your hand and put them into play.

cards.name: Rathi Trapper
cards.text: {B}, {T}: Tap target creature.
cards.flavor: Tangling vines, fetid murk, paralyzing poisons, and crawling dead. The swamp is nature's trap waiting to be exploited by unnatural minds.

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Master Decoy.

cards.originalText: {B}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.name: Parasitic Strix
cards.text:
Flying
When Parasitic Strix enters the battlefield, if you control a black permanent, target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: After finding no sustenance on the edges of Grixis, it turned to the skies of Bant.

rulings.text: The "intervening 'if' clause" means that (1) the ability won't trigger at all unless you control a permanent of the specified color, and (2) the ability will do nothing unless you control a permanent of the specified color at the time it resolves.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Parasitic Strix comes into play, if you control a black permanent, target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Fiery Hellhound
cards.text: {R}: Fiery Hellhound gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: There's nothing more exciting than a game of fetch the still-beating heart.
cards.originalText: {R}: Fiery Hellhound gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Reclaim
cards.text: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
cards.flavor: The wise pay as much attention to what they throw away as to what they keep.
cards.originalText: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.

cards.name: Wing Shards
cards.text:
Target player sacrifices an attacking creature.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)

rulings.text: The copies are put directly onto the stack. They aren't cast and won't be counted by other spells with storm cast later in the turn.
Spells cast from zones other than a player's hand and spells that were countered are counted by the storm ability.
A copy of a spell can be countered like any other spell, but it must be countered individually. Countering a spell with storm won't affect the copies.
The triggered ability that creates the copies can itself be countered by anything that can counter a triggered ability. If it is countered, no copies will be put onto the stack.
You may choose new targets for any of the copies. You can choose differently for each copy.

cards.originalText:
Target player sacrifices an attacking creature.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)

cards.name: Cinder Pyromancer
cards.text:
{T}: Cinder Pyromancer deals 1 damage to target player.
Whenever you cast a red spell, you may untap Cinder Pyromancer.
cards.flavor: "If the whole world burns, I'll never grow cold."
cards.originalText:
{T}: Cinder Pyromancer deals 1 damage to target player.
Whenever you play a red spell, you may untap Cinder Pyromancer.

cards.name: Bazaar of Baghdad
cards.text: {T}: Draw two cards, then discard three cards.

rulings.text: You can't cast spells or activate mana abilities before discarding the extra cards.

cards.originalText: Tap to take two cards from your library, after which you must immediately discard three from your hand to your graveyard. If you don't have three or more cards in your hand, discard your whole hand. No spells may be cast between drawing and discarding cards.

cards.text: {T}, Pay 1 life, Sacrifice Marsh Flats: Search your library for a Plains or Swamp card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: {T}, Pay 1 life, Sacrifice Marsh Flats: Search your library for a Plains or Swamp card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Befoul
cards.text: Destroy target land or nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: The bog's touch means death to all but the darkest of hearts.

rulings.text: This is not modal. You do not have to choose the target type. The target has to either be a land or non-black creature when announced and on resolution.

cards.originalText: Destroy target land or nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.text:
Trample
Whenever another nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: It's there when a seed sprouts, when gourds ripen on the vines, and when the reapers cut the grains under the Harvest Moon.

rulings.text: A creature card that enters the battlefield as a copy of a token creature is still a nontoken creature. You'll be able to draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever another nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card.

Flying
Sacrifice Judge's Familiar: Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller pays {1}.

Defender
{1}{G}, Sacrifice another creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.
cards.flavor: Its hunting instincts have long since rotted away. Its hunger, however, remains.

rulings.text: Use the toughness of the creature as it last existed on the battlefield to determine how much life you gain.

cards.originalText:
Defender
{1}{G}, Sacrifice another creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.

cards.name: Inquisition of Kozilek
cards.text: Target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it with converted mana cost 3 or less. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor: After the awakening of the Eldrazi, some vampires took it upon themselves to remind the others where their loyalty should lie.

rulings.text: If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

cards.originalText: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it with converted mana cost 3 or less. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Scathe Zombies
cards.flavor:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,
Nor Spake, nor moved their eyes;
It had been strange, even in a dream,
To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Coleridge,
"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

cards.name: Talara's Battalion
cards.text:
Cast this spell only if you've cast another green spell this turn.
Trample
cards.flavor: The safewright Talara protects a delicate woodland waterfall. She has vowed to send wave after wave of warriors to slay any who would dare disturb its beauty.
cards.originalText:
Trample
Play Talara's Battalion only if you played another green spell this turn.

cards.name: Gemstone Caverns
cards.text:
If Gemstone Caverns is in your opening hand and you're not playing first, you may begin the game with Gemstone Caverns on the battlefield with a luck counter on it. If you do, exile a card from your hand.
{T}: Add {C}. If Gemstone Caverns has a luck counter on it, instead add one mana of any color.

rulings.text: If multiple Gemstone Caverns are put onto the battlefield under a single player's control before the game begins, the "legend rule" won't put the extras into that player's graveyard until just before the first player gets priority during their first upkeep step. There's no opportunity to tap the extras for mana.

A player's "opening hand" is the hand of cards the player has after all players have taken mulligans and "scryed" if applicable. If players have any cards in hand that allow actions to be taken with them from a player's opening hand, the starting player takes all such actions first in any order, followed by each other player in turn order. Then the first turn begins.

cards.originalText:
If Gemstone Caverns is in your opening hand and you're not playing first, you may begin the game with Gemstone Caverns in play with a luck counter on it. If you do, remove a card in your hand from the game.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If Gemstone Caverns has a luck counter on it, instead add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Here in Fyndhorn, the goddess Freyalise is generous to her children."
—Kolbjörn, elder druid of the Juniper Order
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Abundance
cards.text: If you would draw a card, you may instead choose land or nonland and reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card of the chosen kind. Put that card into your hand and put all other cards revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: This replacement effect replaces the draw, so nothing that triggers on a draw will trigger.

If you use this on a multi-card draw, each replaced draw is handled separately. In other words, you reveal and then put on the bottom of the library for the first card, then do the same for the second, and so on. In a multi-card draw you do not have to choose how many of those draws will be replaced before you do any drawing or use of this card.
If no card of the chosen type is found before your library empties, you don't get a card, but you do get to order all the cards in your library any way you choose.

If your library is empty, Abundance can prevent you from losing the game for being unable to draw a card. If an effect or turn-based action would cause you to draw a card, you can replace that draw with Abundance's replacement effect. (It doesn't matter that you'd be unable to actually draw a card.) Since Abundance's effect has you put a card into your hand instead of drawing a card, you'll never be forced to draw a card with an empty library.

cards.originalText: If you would draw a card, you may instead choose land or nonland and reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card of the chosen kind. Put that card into your hand and put all other cards revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Strafe
cards.text: Strafe deals 3 damage to target nonred creature.
cards.flavor:
"All right, let's light 'em up"
—Gerrard
cards.originalText: Strafe deals 3 damage to target nonred creature.

cards.name: Commando Raid
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature you control gains "When this creature deals combat damage to a player, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature that player controls."
cards.originalText: Until end of turn, target creature you control gains "When this creature deals combat damage to a player, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature that player controls."

cards.name: Inner Fire
cards.text: Add {R} for each card in your hand.
cards.flavor: "Heart of Sokenzan, I call to you! Lend me your fire."
cards.originalText: Add {R} to your mana pool for each card in your hand.

cards.name: Wildcall
cards.text: Manifest the top card of your library, then put X +1/+1 counters on it. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)
cards.flavor: A howl on the wind hides many dangers.

rulings.text: If you choose 0 for X, you'll just manifest the top card of your library.

The face-down permanent is a 2/2 creature with no name, mana cost, creature types, or abilities. It's colorless and has a converted mana cost of 0. Other effects that apply to the permanent can still grant or change any of these characteristics.

Any time you have priority, you may turn a manifested creature face up by revealing that it's a creature card (ignoring any copy effects or type-changing effects that might be applying to it) and paying its mana cost. This is a special action. It doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.
If a manifested creature would have morph if it were face up, you may also turn it face up by paying its morph cost.
Unlike a face-down creature that was cast using the morph ability, a manifested creature may still be turned face up after it loses its abilities if it's a creature card.
Because the permanent is on the battlefield both before and after it's turned face up, turning a permanent face up doesn't cause any enters-the-battlefield abilities to trigger.
Because face-down creatures don't have names, they can't have the same name as any other creature, even another face-down creature.

A permanent that turns face up or face down changes characteristics but is otherwise the same permanent. Spells and abilities that were targeting that permanent, as well as Auras and Equipment that were attached to the permanent, aren't affected.
Turning a permanent face up or face down doesn't change whether that permanent is tapped or untapped.
At any time, you can look at a face-down permanent you control. You can't look at face-down permanents you don't control unless an effect allows you to or instructs you to.
If a face-down permanent you control leaves the battlefield, you must reveal it. You must also reveal all face-down spells and permanents you control if you leave the game or if the game ends.

You must ensure that your face-down spells and permanents can easily be differentiated from each other. You're not allowed to mix up the cards that represent them on the battlefield in order to confuse other players. The order they entered the battlefield should remain clear. Common methods for indicating this include using markers or dice, or simply placing them in order on the battlefield. You must also track how each became face down (manifested, cast face down using the morph ability, and so on).

There are no cards in the Fate Reforged set that would turn a face-down instant or sorcery card on the battlefield face up, but some older cards can try to do this. If something tries to turn a face-down instant or sorcery card on the battlefield face up, reveal that card to show all players it's an instant or sorcery card. The permanent remains on the battlefield face down. Abilities that trigger when a permanent turns face up won't trigger, because even though you revealed the card, it never turned face up.

Some older Magic sets feature double-faced cards, which have a Magic card face on each side rather than a Magic card face on one side and a Magic card back on the other. The rules for double-faced cards are changing slightly to account for the possibility that they are manifested. If a double-faced card is manifested, it will be put onto the battlefield face down. While face down, it can't transform. If the front face of the card is a creature card, you can turn it face up by paying its mana cost. If you do, its front face will be up. A double-faced permanent on the battlefield still can't be turned face down.

cards.originalText: Manifest the top card of your library, then put X +1/+1 counters on it. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

cards.name: Hellspark Elemental
cards.setName: Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning
cards.text:
Trample, haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Hellspark Elemental.
Unearth {1}{R} ({1}{R}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Trample, haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Hellspark Elemental.
Unearth {1}{R} ({1}{R}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Sunfire Balm
cards.text:
Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
Cycling {1}{W} ({1}{W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Sunfire Balm, you may prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

cards.originalText:
Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
Cycling {1}{W} ({1}{W}, Discard this card from your hand: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Sunfire Balm, you may prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Vault of Whispers
cards.text:
(Vault of Whispers isn't a spell.)
{T}: Add {B}.
cards.flavor: Ish Sah, den of the warlord Geth, commander of countless nim.
cards.originalText:
(Vault of Whispers isn't a spell.)
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Oracle's Attendants
cards.text: {T}: All damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn by a source of your choice is dealt to Oracle's Attendants instead.
cards.flavor: They follow the prophecy to each new prophet, guarding the future from the present.
cards.originalText: {T}: All damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn by a source of your choice is dealt to Oracle's Attendants instead.

cards.name: Tuskguard Captain
cards.text:
Outlast {G} ({G}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature. Outlast only as a sorcery.)
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has trample.
cards.flavor: One quiet word sets off the stampede.

rulings.text: The cost to activate a creature's outlast ability includes the tap symbol ({T}). A creature's outlast ability can't be activated unless that creature has been under your control continuously since the beginning of your turn.

Several creatures with outlast also grant an ability to creatures you control with +1/+1 counters on them, including themselves. These counters could come from an outlast ability, but any +1/+1 counter on the creature will count.

cards.originalText:
Outlast {G} ({G}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature. Outlast only as a sorcery.)
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has trample.

—Kakra, sea troll

cards.name: Gaea's Blessing
cards.text:
Target player shuffles up to three target cards from their graveyard into their library.
Draw a card.
When Gaea's Blessing is put into your graveyard from your library, shuffle your graveyard into your library.

rulings.text: If Gaea's Blessing has no legal target cards in a graveyard, either because its targets became illegal or because you didn't choose any, the target player shuffles their library.
If an effect puts multiple cards from your library into your graveyard at once, put all of those cards there before Gaea's Blessing shuffles your graveyard into your library.

cards.originalText:
Target player shuffles up to three target cards from his or her graveyard into his or her library.
Draw a card.
When Gaea's Blessing is put into your graveyard from your library, shuffle your graveyard into your library.

cards.name: Decree of Justice
cards.text:
Create X 4/4 white Angel creature tokens with flying.
Cycling {2}{W} ({2}{W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Justice, you may pay {X}. If you do, create X 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
A mana cost of {X}{X} means that you pay twice X. If you want X to be 3, you pay {8}{W}{W} to cast Decree of Justice.

cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.

{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Siege-Gang Commander deals 2 damage to any target.

rulings.text: You can sacrifice any Goblin you control to activate Siege-Gang Commander's activated ability, not just the ones its triggered ability puts onto the battlefield. You can even sacrifice Siege-Gang Commander itself.

cards.originalText:

cards.name: Aura Gnarlid
cards.text:
Creatures with power less than Aura Gnarlid's power can't block it.
Aura Gnarlid gets +1/+1 for each Aura on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Kill a gnarlid with your first blow, or it'll cheerfully show you how it's done.

rulings.text: The power of each potential blocking creature is checked against Aura Gnarlid's power only as blockers are declared. Once a creature blocks Aura Gnarlid, increasing the Gnarlid's power or decreasing the blocking creature's power won't undo that block.
Aura Gnarlid's second ability counts each Aura regardless of who controls it.

cards.originalText:
Creatures with power less than Aura Gnarlid's power can't block it.
Aura Gnarlid gets +1/+1 for each Aura on the battlefield.

cards.name: Elvish Promenade
cards.text: Create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token for each Elf you control.
cards.flavor: The faultless and immaculate castes form the lower tiers of elvish society, with the exquisite caste above them. At the pinnacle is the perfect, a consummate blend of aristocrat and predator.
cards.originalText: Put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token into play for each Elf you control.

cards.name: Phyrexian Dreadnought
cards.text:
Trample
When Phyrexian Dreadnought enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice any number of creatures with total power 12 or greater.

rulings.text: The sacrifices are simultaneous, not one at a time.
Phasing in does not trigger "enters the battlefield" abilities, so you don't have to sacrifice again if it phases in.
Reverted to its original wording, this now has an enters-the-battlefield triggered ability. During resolution of the triggered ability, you choose one option or the other.
If the Dreadnought is no longer on the battlefield when the triggered ability resolves, you may still choose either option.
If you are unable to sacrifice 12 power worth of creatures, then you cannot choose that option; in that case, you must sacrifice Phyrexian Dreadnought.

cards.name: Brion Stoutarm
cards.text:
Lifelink
{R}, {T}, Sacrifice another creature: Brion Stoutarm deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target player or planeswalker.

rulings.text: If Brion Stoutarm leaves the battlefield after its ability has been activated but before it resolves, the game uses its last known information to determine that it had lifelink and you'll gain life for the damage it deals.

cards.originalText:
Lifelink
{R}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature other than Brion Stoutarm: Brion Stoutarm deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target player.

cards.name: Cancel
cards.text: Counter target spell.
cards.flavor: "I decide what stands in my way."
cards.originalText: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Goblin King
cards.text: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: To become king of the Goblins, one must assassinate the previous king. Thus, only the most foolish seek positions of leadership.

rulings.text: Goblin King now has the Goblin creature type and its ability has been reworded to affect *other* Goblins. This means that if two Goblin Kings are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

cards.source: SQUARE EDGES AND GOLD-BORDERED BACKSIDE, NOT TOURNAMENT LEGAL

cards.name: Psionic Entity

cards.name: Natural Spring

cards.originalText: Target player gains 8 life.

cards.name: Moonsilver Spear
Canopy Vista
cards.text:
({T}: Add {G} or {W}.)
Canopy Vista enters the battlefield tapped unless you control two or more basic lands.

rulings.text: Even though these lands have basic land types, they are not basic lands because "basic" doesn't appear on their type line. Notably, controlling two or more of them won't allow others to enter the battlefield untapped.

However, because these cards have basic land types, effects that specify a basic land type without also specifying that the land be basic can affect them. For example, a spell or ability that reads "Destroy target Forest" can target Canopy Vista, while one that reads "Destroy target basic Forest" cannot.
If one of these lands enters the battlefield at the same time as any number of basic lands, those other lands are not counted when determining if this land enters the battlefield tapped or untapped.

cards.originalText: Canopy Vista enters the battlefield tapped unless you control two or more basic lands.

cards.name: Retreat to Emeria
cards.text:
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, choose one —
• Create a 1/1 white Kor Ally creature token.
• Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: A landfall ability triggers whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control for any reason. It triggers whenever you play a land, as well as whenever a spell or ability puts a land onto the battlefield under your control.

When a land enters the battlefield under your control, each landfall ability of the permanents you control will trigger. You can put them on the stack in any order. The last ability you put on the stack will be the first one to resolve.

If the ability has an additional or replacement effect that depends on the land having a certain basic land type, the ability will check that land's type as the ability resolves. If, at that time, the land that entered the battlefield is no longer on the battlefield, use its types when it left the battlefield to determine what happens.

cards.originalText: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, choose one —• Put a 1/1 white Kor Ally creature token onto the battlefield.• Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Nevermaker
cards.text:
Flying
When Nevermaker leaves the battlefield, put target nonland permanent on top of its owner's library.
Evoke {3}{U} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

rulings.text: Evoke doesn't change the timing of when you can cast the creature that has it. If you could cast that creature spell only when you could cast a sorcery, the same is true for cast it with evoke.

If a creature spell cast with evoke changes controllers before it enters the battlefield, it will still be sacrificed when it enters the battlefield. Similarly, if a creature cast with evoke changes controllers after it enters the battlefield but before its sacrifice ability resolves, it will still be sacrificed. In both cases, the controller of the creature at the time it left the battlefield will control its leaves-the-battlefield ability.
When you cast a spell by paying its evoke cost, its mana cost doesn't change. You just pay the evoke cost instead.

Effects that cause you to pay more or less to cast a spell will cause you to pay that much more or less while casting it for its evoke cost, too. That's because they affect the total cost of the spell, not its mana cost.

Whether evoke's sacrifice ability triggers when the creature enters the battlefield depends on whether the spell's controller chose to pay the evoke cost, not whether they actually paid it (if it was reduced or otherwise altered by another ability, for example).
If you're casting a spell "without paying its mana cost," you can't use its evoke ability.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Nevermaker leaves play, put target nonland permanent on top of its owner's library.
Evoke {3}{U} (You may play this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it comes into play.)
